law.catch_line: Recording of deeds executed out of state.
law.text: Deeds executed out of this state and within the United States or any of its dependencies may be admitted to record when certified, under the seal of his office or court, by a judge, clerk or deputy clerk of a court, or by a notary public, mayor of a city, secretary of state, commissioner authorized to take acknowledgement of deeds or justice of the peace, to have been acknowledged or proved before him in the manner required by KRS 382.130.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 502.
